question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Cryptographic collision] Can an attacker craft transactions to force Sha3_256 hash collisions in table handle generation by manipulating session_hash or table count, allowing them to overwrite existing tables and cause permanent fund loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Determinism violation] Are all validators guaranteed to produce identical table handles for the same transaction, or can non-deterministic behavior in session_hash generation cause state divergence leading to network partition? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Integer overflow] Can table_len cast from usize to u32 overflow on systems with >4 billion tables, causing handle collisions and state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Handle prediction] Can an attacker predict future table handles by observing session_hash patterns, enabling them to pre-create conflicting tables and cause transaction failures or DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [State inconsistency] Does the assertion at line 373-376 properly prevent duplicate table handles in new_tables, or can concurrent transactions bypass this check causing table overwrites? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Gas bypass] Can an attacker avoid NEW_TABLE_HANDLE_BASE gas charges by aborting after handle generation but before gas charging completes, creating free tables? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Type confusion] Can mismatched key_type or value_type in TableInfo cause type safety violations when accessing the table later, enabling unauthorized state mutations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker create unlimited table handles within a single transaction to exhaust validator memory before gas limits trigger, causing validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Digest manipulation] Does the Sha3_256 digest update sequence at lines 364-367 handle big-endian/little-endian differences consistently across architectures, or can this cause determinism violations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_new_table_handle()] [Address truncation] Can truncating Sha3_256 output to AccountAddress::LENGTH cause information loss that increases collision probability, enabling table overwrites? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [TOCTOU race condition] Can concurrent add_box calls for the same key bypass the ALREADY_EXISTS check via race conditions in GlobalValue::move_to, allowing duplicate entries and state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Gas manipulation] Does dropping table_data at line 430 before charging key_cost and mem_usage allow attackers to abort after state mutation but before paying full gas costs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Memory accounting bypass] Can attackers exploit the fix_memory_double_counting feature flag to avoid heap memory charges by timing transactions around flag transitions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Serialization DOS] Can crafted key values with extreme serialization sizes bypass ADD_BOX_PER_BYTE_SERIALIZED gas metering limits and cause validator OOM? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Type safety violation] Can type argument mismatches between ty_args[0] (key), ty_args[1] (ignored?), and ty_args[2] (value) cause memory corruption during serialization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Layout inconsistency] Can key_layout generated from ty_args[0] mismatch with actual key type, allowing serialization to succeed but deserialization to fail permanently locking tables? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [GlobalValue state leak] If move_to fails at line 423, does the GlobalValue remain in an inconsistent cached state that affects future operations on the same key? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Gas metering order] Does charging gas after table_data.drop() at lines 433-437 allow state changes to persist even if gas charging fails, breaking atomicity? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Abstract heap size overflow] Can abstract_heap_size calculations overflow u64 for deeply nested structures, causing incorrect memory charging and OOM vulnerabilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Delayed fields bypass] Can attackers exploit contains_delayed_fields=false values to insert native-only values that bypass proper serialization validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Resolver poisoning] If resolver.resolve_table_entry_bytes_with_layout returns corrupted data for an existing key, can this poison the GlobalValue cache permanently? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_add_box()] [Entry size manipulation] Can attackers create entries that serialize to different sizes in get_or_create_global_value vs serialize_value, causing gas accounting errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Phantom read attack] Can borrowing a non-existent key that gets resolved from storage create a cached GlobalValue that enables future exploits via state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Reference lifetime violation] Does borrow_global() return a reference with proper lifetime guarantees, or can the underlying GlobalValue be mutated while references exist? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/table-natives/src/lib.rs] [Function: native_borrow_box()] [Deserialization DOS] Can maliciously crafted stored bytes cause exponential deserialization time in deserialize_value, enabling validator slowdown attacks? (High)
